==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Preta}}
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|が|き}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=かき'}} compound {{m|zh|餓鬼|tr=nga<sup>H</sup> kjwɨj<sup>X</sup>|lit=hungry + ghost}}.  Compare modern {{etyl|nan|-}} reading ''gō-kúi''.  The {{etyl|zh|-}} term derives from the [[importation]] of {{w|Buddhism}} into {{w|China}}, as a [[translation]] of {{cog|sa|प्रेत}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|がき|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=1|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|がき}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かき'|Buddhism}} short for {{m|ja|餓鬼道|tr=gakidō}}: the [[hungry ghost]] [[realm]], one of the six realms of [[reincarnation]] in Buddhist [[cosmology]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=かき'|Buddhism}} a [[preta]]: the [[spirit]] of a [[jealous]] or [[greedy]] person who, as [[punishment]] for [[mortal]] [[vice]]s, has been [[cursed]] with [[insatiable]] [[hunger]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=かき'|Buddhism}} the [[soul]]s of the [[dead]] who [[languish]] in [[oblivion]] without any surviving relatives to pray for their peace
# {{lb|ja|sort=かき'|metaphor}} anyone who is constantly [[hungry]] or [[thirsty]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=かき'|metaphor}} anyone who is [[unhealthily]] [[thin]] and appears as if they are [[starving]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=かき'|pejorative|slang|by extension from the sense of someone who is always hungry}} an [[unpleasant]] [[child]], a [[brat]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=かき'|archaic}} short for {{m|ja|餓鬼病|tr=gakiyami</i>, <i>gakibyō}}: [[leprosy]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=がっき}}
Shift in pronunciation of ''gaki'' above.  [[gemination|Gemination]] is a common form of [[emphasis]] in the process of {{etyl|ja|-}} [[word]] [[formation]].  The meaning of {{m|en|brat}} is by extension from the original sense of ''gaki'' above, referring to ''someone who is always hungry''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|がっき}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|餓っ鬼}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|がっき}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かき'|pejorative|slang}} an [[unpleasant]] [[child]], a [[brat]]

=====Usage notes=====
Often spelled in [[hiragana]].
